perturbation.original_text: This Cooperation Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of June 18, 2020, by and between Spôk Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Company"), and White Hat Strategic Partners LP, a Delaware limited partnership, White Hat SP GP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, White Hat Capital Partners LP, a Delaware limited partnership, and White Hat Capital Partners GP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (collectively, the "White Hat Parties") (each of the Company and the White Hat Parties, a "Party" to this Agreement, and collectively, the "Parties").
perturbation.changed_text: This Cooperation Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of June 18, 2020, by and between Spôk Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Company"), and White Hat Strategic Partners LP, a Delaware limited partnership, White Hat SP GP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, White Hat Capital Partners LP, a Delaware limited partnership, and White Hat Capital Partners GP LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (collectively, the "White Hat Group") (each of the Company and the White Hat Parties, a "Party" to this Agreement, and collectively, the "Parties").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'White Hat Parties' is changed to 'White Hat Group'. Throughout the document, 'White Hat Parties' and 'White Hat Group' will be used interchangeably without explicitly defining if they encompass the exact same entities. This will create ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: The White Hat Parties shall appear in person or by proxy for quorum purposes at the 2020 Annual Meeting, including any adjournment or postponement thereof, to vote all of the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties on the record date (if the 2020 Annual Meeting is within thirty (30) days of the anniversary of the Company's 2019 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, such number of shares shall be no less than 90% of the Current Position) for such meeting (i) in favor of all persons nominated by the Board to serve as directors of the Company and against any stockholder nominated candidate not endorsed by the Board, (ii) against the stockholder proposal made pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act as disclosed to the White Hat Parties prior to the execution of this Agreement, (iii) to ratify the appointment of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, and (iv) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal and new equity compensation plan (collectively, the "2020 Proposals"), provided, that with respect to the proposals described in clauses (ii) through (iv) of this Section 4, the White Hat Parties may vote in accordance with the recommendation of Institutional Shareholders Services to the extent such recommendation differs from the voting commitments set forth herein and provided that the White Hat Parties do not publicly disclose their vote on such proposals if it differs from the Board's recommendation; and provided, further, that White Hat Parties shall have the right to vote the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties in their sole discretion with respect to all other proposals brought before the 2020 Annual Meeting. The White Hat Parties shall provide written evidence of the votes made in accordance with the foregoing sentence to the Company no later than ten business days before the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: The White Hat Group shall appear in person or by proxy for quorum purposes at the 2020 Annual Meeting, including any adjournment or postponement thereof, to vote all of the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties on the record date (if the 2020 Annual Meeting is within thirty (30) days of the anniversary of the Company's 2019 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, such number of shares shall be no less than 90% of the Current Position) for such meeting (i) in favor of all persons nominated by the Board to serve as directors of the Company and against any stockholder nominated candidate not endorsed by the Board, (ii) against the stockholder proposal made pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act as disclosed to the White Hat Parties prior to the execution of this Agreement, (iii) to ratify the appointment of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm, and (iv) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal and new equity compensation plan (collectively, the "2020 Proposals"), provided, that with respect to the proposals described in clauses (ii) through (iv) of this Section 4, the White Hat Parties may vote in accordance with the recommendation of Institutional Shareholders Services to the extent such recommendation differs from the voting commitments set forth herein and provided that the White Hat Parties do not publicly disclose their vote on such proposals if it differs from the Board's recommendation; and provided, further, that White Hat Parties shall have the right to vote the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the White Hat Parties in their sole discretion with respect to all other proposals brought before the 2020 Annual Meeting. The White Hat Group shall provide written evidence of the votes made in accordance with the foregoing sentence to the Company no later than ten business days before the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.explanation: Using "White Hat Group" and "White Hat Parties" interchangeably in the same paragraph, especially when assigning obligations and rights, creates confusion. It's unclear if all members of the 'White Hat Group' are bound by obligations related to the 'White Hat Parties'.

perturbation.original_text: The White Hat Parties agree that they shall not issue a press release regarding the subject matter of this Agreement for a period of three (3) months after the date of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The White Hat Group agrees that the Stakeholders shall not issue a press release regarding the subject matter of this Agreement for a period of three (3) months after the date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced the term 'White Hat Parties' with 'the Stakeholders'. It introduces a contradiction by creating uncertainty about who is bound by the press release restriction. It is not explicitly defined if 'Stakeholders' is the same with 'White Hat Parties' or 'White Hat Group'.
